page.title: 02Fairfield Court, Fairfield
page.content: We visited Fairfield Court built in 16th century. Mrs Edge came out to meet us then we went inside the Court. First we went into the lounge which used to be 2 rooms and there used to be a ladder leading upstairs. We went into a bedroom which was very sloping, then on to the landing and looked at the banisters. We went in a room where there used to be a little chapel. When we were going down the stairs to go into the garden we saw a priest hole. Outside Mr Edge showed us the gardens. After that he told us where the gallows were and that they had found an animal bone, which they had taken to the vets.The vet told them it was a human leg bone. There were some steps made from mill stones Also around the garden there are staddle stones. We went on to the front lawn and drew a picture.
